citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility has not developed a written program of veterinary care for the birds maintained at the facility. The written
program of veterinary care is needed to ensure that the facility understands the expectations of the attending veterinarian
regarding the veterinary care of the regulated animals. The facility should ensure that the written program of veterinary
care is available for review during all USDA inspections, with the documented arrangements to include regularly
scheduled visits to the premise of the facility.
Correct by October 13, 2023.

The facility has not conducted an annual review of their contingency plan. Reviewing the outlined plan in place ensures
the facility has assessed the current plan for any needed amendments to better prepare for unexpected disasters or
events, as well as a detailed strategy to address instructions for, but not limited to: animal evacuation, sheltering-in-place,
and backup provisions for husbandry and food/watering supplies, sanitation, and ventilation. The facility shall develop and
document an appropriate contingency plan available for review upon USDA inspections.
Correct by October 6, 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a written environmental enrichment plan for the birds on-hand at the facility. Maintaining a
documented enrichment plan ensures adequate provisions are in place to promote and sustain the psychological well-
being and needs of the avian species housed. An enrichment plan must be developed, documented, followed, and
approved by the attending veterinarian, in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and currently accepted
professional standards.
Correct by October 13, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
